channel.title: slumstyle on Slumdown
channel.description: Recent content in slumstyle on Slumdown

item.title: Tutorial part 2: Writing a post
item.description: Like any blogdown post, a slumdown post is written in R Markdown, and uses a few custom fields in the YAML field. This tutorial provides an illustration of how different kinds of content are displayed.

item.title: Tutorial part 3: Colour palettes in slumdown
item.description: The main reason I wrote slumdown (besides boredom) was to make it easy to include user-defined colours palettes in blogdown, and expose those palettes to R so that (for instance) plots can be drawn in a style that matches the blog style. This tutorial introduces this palette system.

item.title: Tutorial part 4: Customising the header
item.description: Slumdown allows the user to control the background image at the top of each post, the profile image overlaid in the middle of that image, and the caption attached to the header image. This post describes how this is done.

item.title: Tutorial part 5: Deploying to GitHub
item.description: This tutorial describes how to deploy a site. Blogdown sites are very often deployed to Netlify, but I have a personal bias to use GitHub Pages, so slumdown is configured by default to use GitHub.
